title: Setup mypy for static type checking
description: Configure mypy for static type checking with strict mode. Create mypy.ini with appropriate settings for gradual typing, excluding third-party packages as needed. Ensure all code uses type hints.

comments.author: jared@goatbytes.io
comments.content:
Setup mypy for static type checking:

**Configuration (pyproject.toml):**
- Python version: 3.10
- Strict mode enabled
- Comprehensive type checking rules:
  - warn_return_any: true
  - warn_unused_configs: true
  - disallow_untyped_defs: true
  - disallow_any_generics: true
  - check_untyped_defs: true
  - no_implicit_reexport: true
  - warn_redundant_casts: true
  - warn_unused_ignores: true
  - warn_no_return: true
  - follow_imports: normal

**Module Overrides:**
- Configured ignore_missing_imports for external libraries:
  - textual.*
  - langchain.*
  - langchain_openai.*
  - langchain_anthropic.*
  - langchain_google_genai.*

**PEP 561 Compliance:**
- Added py.typed marker file for type hint distribution
- Enables IDE and type checker support for consumers

**Verification:**
- mypy src/: Success - no issues found (6 source files)
- mypy tests/: Success - no issues found (5 source files)
- All existing code already has proper type hints
- Ready for strict type checking in development
